text: The Twenty-fourth Amendment to the United States Constitution is the twenty- fourth time the United States Constitution has been amended (revised). The twenty-fourth amendment prevents the United States Congress and US states from charging a poll tax on federal elections. The amendment was proposed by Congress to the states on August 27, 1962, and was ratified by the states on January 23, 1964. ==Text== ==References== *24 Category:Democratic rights
title: Twenty-fourth Amendment to the United States Constitution
